question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Constant: CACHE_SIZE_ESTIMATION] [Misconfiguration] Is CACHE_SIZE_ESTIMATION (250,000 transactions) appropriate for Aptos's transaction throughput, or could high-load scenarios exceed this causing excessive cache misses? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Constant: MAX_CACHE_FETCH_SIZE] [Unused Constant] Line 16 defines MAX_CACHE_FETCH_SIZE but it's never used in the code - is this a security control that should be enforced but isn't? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Constant: CACHE_SIZE_EVICTION_LOWER_BOUND] [Buffer Gap] The 50,000 transaction gap between CACHE_SIZE_ESTIMATION and CACHE_SIZE_EVICTION_LOWER_BOUND is mentioned as a buffer, but is this sufficient for high concurrency scenarios? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Lines: 26-29] [Key Constants] Are CACHE_KEY_LATEST_VERSION and CACHE_KEY_CHAIN_ID hardcoded strings safe, or could key collision with user data keys cause cache corruption? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Constant: BASE_EXPIRATION_EPOCH_TIME_IN_SECONDS] [Y10K Bug] The expiration date is set to 9999-12-31 - could this cause issues with date parsing or overflow in systems that don't support far-future dates? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Enum: CacheBatchGetStatus] [State Handling] Do callers properly handle all three enum variants (Ok, EvictedFromCache, NotReady), or could unhandled cases cause panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Enum: CacheUpdateStatus] [Unused Enum] CacheUpdateStatus is defined but never returned by any function - is this dead code or a missing feature? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Enum: CacheCoverageStatus] [Boundary Conditions] Does CacheHit(u64) properly represent the range semantics, or could off-by-one errors cause incorrect range calculations? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Struct: CacheOperator] [Clone Safety] The Clone trait is implemented for CacheOperator - does cloning create independent Redis connections, or do clones share connections causing concurrency issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Multiple Functions] [Async Safety] Are the async functions truly safe for concurrent execution, or can interleaved operations on the same CacheOperator instance cause data races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Lines: 106-112] [Mutable Reference] Many functions take &mut self - does this prevent concurrent reads, or is the mutex-like behavior at the Redis level sufficient for safety? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Multiple Functions] [Non-Atomic Operations] Functions like check_cache_coverage_status() followed by batch_get_encoded_proto_data() create a time-of-check-time-of-use gap - can this cause races? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Function: get_file_store_latest_version()] [Consistency] Can file store version and cache latest_version diverge significantly, causing data inconsistency between file store and cache tiers? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Function: update_file_store_latest_version()] [Version Ordering] Does the function validate that latest_version is monotonically increasing, or can version rollbacks corrupt the file store state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Lines: 182-190] [Race Condition] Can multiple workers update file_store_latest_version concurrently, causing last-writer-wins races that skip versions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Constant: FILE_STORE_LATEST_VERSION] [Key Collision] Is the file store version key namespaced separately from cache keys, or could collisions corrupt both stores? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Multiple Functions] [Error Context] Do error context messages expose sensitive Redis connection details or internal state that could help attackers? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Multiple Functions] [Panic on Unwrap] Multiple unwrap() and expect() calls can panic on malformed Redis data - should these use safer error handling? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Multiple Functions] [Vector Allocation] Functions allocate vectors for version ranges without size limits - can attackers request huge ranges causing OOM? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-utils/src/cache_operator.rs] [Lines: 228-230] [Key String Allocation] Does building cache keys in a loop allocate many String objects, causing memory pressure under high load? (Low)
